value:
"This is the planning roadmap for the [uroflavin/roadmap](https://github.com/uroflavin/roadmap) project. 
It acts as both the plan for implementing this tool as well as a demonstration of what a roadmap might look like.

One good example is this roadmap itself. 
What to-do and what is already done to implement roadmap.py can you see in this picture.

![Roadmap Objectives and Keyresults
column3:
rendered from roadmap.yml](roadmap.dot.png)

One of the things you'll immediately notice about this file is that it uses *Markdown* for formatting of text and is designed around a structured YAML schema. 
The goal is to make this as easy as possible for humans to read and reason about
column4: while also enabling powerful visualizations to be generated based on the content.\n"

value: "This is the day that the project was started.\n"
"This is the scheduled date for the first demo of this project to a wider audience.\n"

column3: we published this project\n"
universal
primarily
column4: to provide a single schema that can be used by different teams to describe the work they are doing and their future intentions. \nThe usefulness and applicability of this schema to real-world problem domains will determine whether anything else we do here is of value.\n"

value: "Develop a schema that fulfills the main requirements of the objective"
"We provide official tooling for most common use cases"
"While the goal of having a single unified schema for planning is that it enables the development of tools that automate various aspects of planning
column3: most teams are not going to adopt this if the fundamentals aren't already solved for them. \nThis includes things like being able to visualize your road map in common formats
column4: validating it against the schema etc.\n"

value: "We should be able to generate some markdown out of roadmap.yml\n"
"We should be able to generate some html out of roadmap.yml\n"
"We should be able to generate some dot out of roadmap.yml\n"

"Excel is THE projectmanagement tool. \nTo render some progress in your favorite tool ;-) we should be able to generate some csv out of roadmap.yml-milestone and deliverables.\nCSV is limited capable for exporting everything
column3: so this would be a good first step towards Roadmap als XLS-File.\n"

value: "We should be able to generate some xls out of roadmap.yml\n"
"Adoption of something intended to make planning easier is only going to be successful if it is easy to use
column3: and a critical part of that is great documentation. \nOur goal is that someone with no familiarity with our tooling can ramp up and have an initial road map ready for use within only a few minutes.\n"

value: "We need to complete our README explaining the purpose of this project and giving some basic examples of its use.\n"
"Complete the examples so that every user of the schema is able to find suitable examples for their specific use cases"
"The design and planning stage is where we're figuring out how this project should work and
column3: broadly
column4: what kind of information we want to show on our road maps.\nWe should do something for the [roadmap](https://github.com/uroflavin/roadmap)

value: "We need to add a README file explaining the purpose of this project and giving some basic examples of its use.\n"
"We need to know what the roadmap file format looks like
column3: so we'll get started with an example roadmap to kick the tyres.\n"

value: "Once we know how we want a road map file to look
column3: we should put together a schema for the file. \nThis will allow us to document the file structure and provide a first class editing experience to people using it.\n"

value: "Put together a JSONSchema file describing the road map file format.\n"
"Publish the schema file on [github](https://https://github.com/uroflavin/roadmap) so that people can reference it easily.\n"

column3: to implement an markdown renderer
column4: which is capable to render this yml as markdown.\n"

value: "Understand the Syntax of the go-template from https://github.com/SierraSoftworks/roadmap/blob/main/tools/roadmap-md/roadmap.basic.md\n"
"Develop a jinja2 template for markdown output of the roadmap\n"
"Put some code in roadmap.py to render roadmap as Markdown\n"

column3: to implement a html-renderer
column4: which is capable to render this yml as html\n"

value: "Develop a template for html output of the roadmap\nUse SierraSoftworks-Go-Template as a starting point\n"
"Put some code in roadmap.py to render roadmap as HTML\n"

column3: to implement a dot-file
column4: which is capable to render this yml as graphviz.\n"

value: "Develop a dot-template for graphviz output of the roadmap\n"
"Put some code in roadmap.py to render roadmap as dot-file\n"
"Put some code in roadmap.py to convert dot-file to png\ne.g. the generated file roadmap.dot.png can be used in your project description.\n"

column3: to implement a xls-renderer
column4: which is capable to render this yml as xls File to open in your prefered spreadsheet software.\n"

value: "Develop a template for csv output of the roadmap\ncsv output should contain all roadmap items
column3:
without the meta-information regarding your project.

The following Roadmap Items will be exported:

- milestones
- deliverables
- objectives
- keyresults
- todos

for each object item the following attributes will be rendered:

- type: will be concatenated form the roadmap-object-name
- _id: internal id
- id
- requirement
- state
- title
- date
- description
- reference.name
- reference.link
- _has_todos: calculated if item it has any todos
"

value: "Put some code in roadmap.py to render roadmap as XLS File\n"

column3: but being able to see things like the description of your deliverables and their current state is something that most users are probably going to find quite useful. \nPair that with a need to make tinkering and experimentation easy and there are few things better than an interactive website to show your road map.\nThe goal here is to produce something which is easy and pleasurable to use
column4: which shows your road map in a format which can be understood and makes interacting with it as low-fuss as possible.\n"

value: "We need more information about the size"
"Find out the dependencies of the Graphviz Library"
"What requirements does Graphviz have and what are the hurdles?\nSee [graphviz.org](https://graphviz.org/)\n"
"The most important part of this milestone is the development of a web based renderer which can present a road map file. \nThis renderer is going to form the basis for our user flows
column3: including acting as a realtime preview for the editor and a final output for the repository viewer.      \n"

value: "Some teams might want to host a version of the renderer on their own website
column3: in which case we should provide them with a package that lets them use the Road Map web renderer"
